ferc_filing_data.tariff_title: Yankee Atomic Electric Company Rate Schedule

record_data.record_plain_text: 8. Return of Excess Decommissioning Funding. Upon corporate wind-up of Yankee, and after decommissioning and spent fuel storage is completed, any funds remaining in the nuclear decommissioning trust funds shall be credited to the Customers.
record_data.filing_title: Baseline Filing of Amended Rate Schedule

record_data.record_plain_text: 7. Investment Earnings Reporting. By no later than April 1 of each calendar year during the period covered by the schedule of charges in this Appendix B, starting with April 1, 2008, Yankee will provide the Signatories and the FERC Staff with its calculation of (i) actual earnings of nuclear decommissioning trust fund ( NDTF ) investments during the Reporting Period, after taxes and fees; and (ii) the difference, if any, between such earnings and the earnings assumption for that Reporting Period. For purposes of this section 7, the Reporting Period shall mean the period from January 1 through December 31 of the previous calendar year. The earnings assumption shall mean the projected earnings on NDTF investment for the Reporting Period contained in the most recent analysis of the adequacy of the NDTF accepted or approved by the FERC. Yankee shall provide workpapers used to derive its calculations.
record_data.filing_title: Baseline Filing of Amended Rate Schedule

record_data.record_plain_text: 6. If Yankee sells all or any portion of the land at the plant site, and to the extent the proceeds of the sale exceed the book value of the land (allocated in the case of a sale of a portion of the land at the site), escalated to take account of inflation (as measured by the average GDP price deflator from 1960 through the year of the transaction), the difference shall be deposited in the decommissioning trust fund to cover potential increases in decommissioning costs that would otherwise be borne by the Customers. Upon completion of decommissioning and spent fuel storage, the trust will be dissolved and any excess will be credited to the Customers.
record_data.filing_title: Baseline Filing of Amended Rate Schedule

record_data.record_plain_text: 13. Addresses Except as the parties may from time to time otherwise agree, any notice, request, demand, statement, bill or payment provided for in this contract or any other notice which either party may desire to give to the other, shall be in writing and shall be effective upon delivery to the other party. Any such communication shall be considered as duly delivered when mailed by either registered or ordinary mail to the respective post office addresses shown following the signatures of the parties hereto.
record_data.filing_title: Baseline Filing of Amended Rate Schedule

record_data.record_plain_text: 9. Annual Reports. Beginning in April 2008, Yankee shall provide the Signatories and the Commission Staff with annual reports of Yankee's actual Long Term Fuel Storage costs during the preceding calendar year. In those reports, Yankee shall segregate Long Term Fuel Storage costs into the same categories into which those costs are separated in the Settlement Estimate. Yankee shall include with each report copies of invoices for all Long Term Fuel Storage costs it incurred during the prior year in an amount greater than $100,000 in any of the following categories: (1) security; (2) environmental; (3) accounting; (4) auditing; (5) regulatory; (6) legal; (7) property taxes; and (8) insurance, subject, if necessary, to appropriate protection for confidential information. Yankee s first report, in April 2008, will cover Long Term Spent Fuel Storage Costs incurred since January 1, 2006. Subsequent reports will cover the costs incurred in the calendar year prior to the report.
record_data.filing_title: Baseline Filing of Amended Rate Schedule

record_data.record_plain_text: 5. Deliveries and Metering Deliveries will be made in the form of three-phase, 60-cycle, alternating current at a nominal voltage of 115,000 volts, at a step-up substation owned by Yankee at the plant site. The Customer will make suitable arrangements for the transmission of the electricity so delivered to it by Yankee. Yankee will supply all necessary metering equipment for determining the quantity and conditions of supply of all electricity delivered hereunder, and will maintain the accuracy of such equipment within limits of 2% up or down. In addition to regular routine tests, Yankee will have any such meter tested at any time upon the written request of the Customer, and if such meter shall prove to be accurate within 2% up or down, the expense of the test shall be borne by the Customer. Yankee will furnish the Customer monthly, or oftener if requested by the Customer, with a summary of the meter readings relating to the services rendered hereunder, and upon request will make available its metering records for the Customer's inspection and review.
record_data.filing_title: Baseline Filing of Amended Rate Schedule

record_data.record_plain_text: 7. Audit Yankee's books and records, insofar as they pertain to the service rendered hereunder or to any charges made therefor, shall be open to the Customer's inspection and audit.
record_data.filing_title: Baseline Filing of Amended Rate Schedule

record_data.record_plain_text: 9. Regulation Performance of this contract is subject to all applicable state and federal laws and to all rules, regulations and orders properly issued thereunder by any governmental agency having jurisdiction in the premises.
record_data.filing_title: Baseline Filing of Amended Rate Schedule

record_data.record_plain_text: 8. Arbitration In case any dispute shall arise as to the interpretation of this contract, which cannot be settled by mutual agreement, such dispute shall be submitted to arbitration. The parties shall, if possible, agree upon a single arbitrator. In case of failure to agree upon an arbitrator within 15 days after the delivery by either party to the other of a written notice requesting arbitration, either party may request the American Arbitration Association to appoint the arbitrator. The arbitrator, after opportunity for each of the parties to be heard, shall consider and decide the dispute and notify the parties in writing of his decision. Such decision shall be binding upon the parties, and the expense of the arbitration shall be borne equally by them.
record_data.filing_title: Baseline Filing of Amended Rate Schedule

record_data.record_plain_text: 4. Customer's Entitlement The Customer shall be entitled, throughout the term of this contract, to its power percentage of the capacity and net electrical output of the plant.
record_data.filing_title: Baseline Filing of Amended Rate Schedule

record_data.record_plain_text: Yankee Atomic Electric Company POWER CONTRACT (Through Amendment No. 10) POWER CONTRACT dated June 30, 1959, as revised April 1, 1975, between YANKEE ATOMIC ELECTRIC COMPANY ("Yankee") and (the names of the Customers appear in the attached Appendix A) (the "Customer"). Yankee is a Massachusetts electric company, organized in 1954, which has constructed and placed in operation a nuclear power plant, the output of which is sold to the New England utilities which are its stockholders. The plant is located at a site owned by Yankee in Rowe, Massachusetts, and consists of a pressurized water reactor and associated steam electric generating, transformation and auxiliary equipment have a net electrical capacity of 176,000 KW (the "plant"). The Atomic Energy Commission has authorized operation of the plant during an initial 40-year term extending to November 4, 1997, pursuant to License No. DPR-3. The percentages of Yankee's outstanding stock held by the Customer and other stockholders of Yankee and the percentages of the capacity and net electrical output of the plant being purchased by them are as follows: Stock Percentage Power Percentage New England Power Company* 34.5% 34.5% The Connecticut Light and Power Company 24.5** 24.5** Boston Edison Company 9.5 9.5 Central Maine Power Company 9.5 0.0*** Western Massachusetts Electric Company 7.0 7.0 Public Service Company of New Hampshire 7.0 16.5*** Commonwealth Electric Company 2.5 2.5 Cambridge Electric Light Company 2.0 2.0 Central Vermont Public Service Corporation 3.5 3.5 100.0% 100.0% *For itself and as successor in interest to Montaup Electric Company. **Represents the consolidation of two prior existing contracts, one with The Connecticut Light and Power Company for 15% and one with The Hartford Electric Light Company for 9.5%, those two companies having merged. ***Public Service Company of New Hampshire has agreed to supply power to Central Maine Power Company in amounts equivalent to 9.5% of the net electric output of the Yankee plant, after appropriate allowance for transmission losses. The parties hereto agree as follows:
record_data.filing_title: Baseline Filing of Amended Rate Schedule

record_data.record_plain_text: 1. Scope of Contract Yankee will sell and deliver to the Customer and the Customer will take and pay for its power percentage of the net electrical output of the plant during the term of this contract.
record_data.filing_title: Baseline Filing of Amended Rate Schedule

record_data.record_plain_text: 3. Operation of the Plant Yankee will operate and maintain the plant in accordance with good utility practice and all applicable laws and rules and regulations thereunder, including the applicable provisions of the Atomic Energy Act of 1954. Yankee reserves the exclusive right to control scheduling of the operation and maintenance of the plant, including outages for inspection, maintenance, refueling, and repairs and replacements. Subject to the foregoing, and until otherwise determined by Yankee's board of directors, the plant shall be subject to central dispatch pursuant to Section 12 of the New England Power Pool Agreement dated as of September 1, 1971, as from time to time amended.
record_data.filing_title: Baseline Filing of Amended Rate Schedule

record_data.record_plain_text: 2. Term of Contract This contract shall continue in full force and effect until the expiration of any license as issued by the Nuclear Regulatory Commission, or any successor agency, with respect to the plant under applicable provisions of the Atomic Energy Act of 1954, as amended from time to time, provided, however, that if the stockholders of Yankee, by vote of not less than 75% in interest of the outstanding stock having general voting rights, shall at any time vote to discontinue the operation of the plant or to liquidate Yankee and wind up its affairs, the obligations of the parties hereunder shall thereupon terminate. Notwithstanding the foregoing, the applicable provisions of this contract shall continue in effect after any termination hereof to the extent necessary (i) to complete the billings and payments required hereunder with respect to the Customer's obligation to pay its power percentage of the full cost of decommissioning the plant in accordance herewith and (ii) to permit final billings and adjustments hereunder with respect to all other obligations of the parties hereunder, including all billings and adjustments with respect to the recovery of Yankee's total cost of service, as provided in Section 6 hereof, until the non-salvageable investment in plant, nuclear fuel and materials and supplies or other assets has been fully amortized in accordance herewith.
record_data.filing_title: Baseline Filing of Amended Rate Schedule

record_data.record_plain_text: 4. Instead of storing Yankee s spent nuclear fuel and greater than Class C ( GTCC ) nuclear waste at the Rowe site, it is preferable from a homeland security and economic standpoint to store that spent nuclear fuel and GTCC waste at a facility outside New England, pursuant to all applicable licensing requirements (an Alternate Facility ), until the United States Department of Energy ( DOE ) takes action to fulfill its obligation to dispose of the spent fuel and GTCC waste at a permanent geological repository. The monies identified in the Settlement Estimate for maintenance and security of the spent nuclear fuel and GTCC waste while it is stored at the Yankee site after 2005 could be spent to pay for temporary storage at an Alternate Facility outside New England, including at currently existing nuclear waste storage sites owned by DOE, when any obstacles to doing so can be overcome. In order to further this objective: a. Yankee will brief the Parties (either in person or by conference call) at least once every quarter on the steps it has taken to facilitate moving Yankee s spent nuclear fuel to a licensed facility outside New England; b. Yankee will undertake reasonable efforts to persuade relevant state and federal legislators to support moving Yankee s spent nuclear fuel to a site outside New England and will, if the Parties agree and if funding is assured, engage professional lobbyists to assist in this effort; c. Among other lobbying efforts, Yankee will continue to undertake reasonable efforts to support legislation for federal funding to develop and build a transport cask that can be used to transport Yankee s spent nuclear fuel; d. Although transportation of spent nuclear fuel from the Yankee site is the contractual responsibility of DOE, Yankee will undertake reasonable efforts to work with the other shutdown nuclear plants in New England to develop, fund, and build a transport cask or casks that can be used to transport spent nuclear fuel from those plants, provided that Yankee shall not be obligated by this provision to procure a transport cask; e. Yankee and the Parties will work cooperatively to identify all potentially viable alternatives for temporary storage of Yankee s spent nuclear fuel and GTCC waste outside New England, including at existing DOE-owned nuclear waste storage sites, until DOE takes the spent nuclear fuel and GTCC waste for permanent disposal; to identify any obstacles to utilizing any such alternatives as well as possible means for overcoming those obstacles; and to evaluate the feasibility and cost-effectiveness of any such alternatives. f. No later than December 1, 2003, Yankee shall conduct a study and provide a draft report to the Parties addressing the topics identified in subsection (e) of this section 4 (the Alternatives Report ), and, no later than one month after receiving comments and suggestions from the other Parties, Yankee will prepare and provide to the other Parties a final Alternatives Report; g. No later than one month after the issuance of the final Alternatives Report, Yankee and the Parties will jointly identify priorities among the feasible alternatives identified in the Alternatives Report and will prepare a written plan for pursuing the highest priority alternative(s), including plans for overcoming any identified obstacles; h. Yankee and the Parties shall work cooperatively to support all of the efforts described above; and i. Yankee will make reasonable efforts to secure DOE funding, reimbursement, or damages for costs of activities that Yankee undertakes in furtherance of the efforts described above, including the preparation of the Alternatives Report. Such costs shall be considered decommissioning expenses that are recoverable from the Customers, unless DOE has funded those efforts and provided that Yankee shall credit any subsequent reimbursement or damages received from DOE in accordance with Section 5. Nothing in this section 4 shall require Yankee to take any action that may jeopardize its position that DOE is responsible for the permanent disposal of spent nuclear fuel and GTCC waste or its claim for compensation for the costs it has incurred or will incur for the interim storage and/or transportation of spent nuclear fuel and GTCC waste, including, without limitation, costs of a transport cask.
record_data.filing_title: Baseline Filing of Amended Rate Schedule

record_data.record_plain_text: 11. Amendments Upon authorization by its board of directors of a uniform amendment to all customer power contracts, Yankee shall have the right to amend the provisions of Section 6 hereof by serving an appropriate statement of such amendment upon the Customer and filing the same with the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (or such other regulatory agency as may have jurisdiction in the premises) in accordance with the provisions of applicable laws and any rules and regulations thereunder, and the amendment shall thereupon become effective on the date specified therein, subject to any suspension order duly issued by such agency. All other amendments to this contract shall be by mutual agreement, evidenced by a written amendment signed by the parties hereto.
record_data.filing_title: Baseline Filing of Amended Rate Schedule

record_data.record_plain_text: 10. Effective Date This revised contract shall become effective on April 1, 1985, subject to any suspension order duly issued by the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission.
record_data.filing_title: Baseline Filing of Amended Rate Schedule

record_data.record_plain_text: 12. Interpretation The interpretation and performance of this contract shall be in accordance with and controlled by the laws of the Commonwealth of Massachusetts.
record_data.filing_title: Baseline Filing of Amended Rate Schedule

record_data.record_plain_text: Appendix A Names of Customers NEW ENGLAND POWER COMPANY (For itself and as successor in interest to Montaup Electric Company) THE CONNECTICUT LIGHT AND POWER COMPANY BOSTON EDISON COMPANY CENTRAL MAINE POWER COMPANY WESTERN MASSACHUSETTS ELECTRIC COMPANY PUBLIC SERVICE COMPANY OF NEW HAMPSHIRE COMMONWEALTH ELECTRIC COMPANY CAMBRIDGE ELECTRIC LIGHT COMPANY CENTRAL VERMONT PUBLIC SERVICE CORPORATION
record_data.filing_title: Baseline Filing of Amended Rate Schedule

record_data.record_plain_text: 14. Corporate Obligation This contract is the corporate act and obligation of the parties hereto, and any claim hereunder against any stockholder, director or officer of either party, as such, is expressly waived. IN WITNESS WHEREOF the parties have executed this revised contract by their respective officers thereunto duly authorized as of the captioned date.
record_data.filing_title: Baseline Filing of Amended Rate Schedule

record_data.record_plain_text: 3. [Reserved]
record_data.filing_title: Yankee Atomic Application to Reduce Rates Under Wholesale Power Contract

record_data.record_title: Reconciliation of D and D Costs

record_data.record_title: Assumptions for Decommissioning Trust Investment Earnings
record_data.record_plain_text: Appendix C [Reserved]
record_data.filing_title: Yankee Atomic Application to Reduce Rates Under Wholesale Power Contract

record_data.record_plain_text: 5. [Reserved]
record_data.filing_title: Yankee Atomic Application to Reduce Rates Under Wholesale Power Contract

record_data.record_plain_text: 6. Payment With respect to each month commencing on and after April 1, 1985, the Customer will pay Yankee an amount equal to the Customer's power percentage of the total cost of service for such month to all customers of Yankee. The total cost of service for any month shall be the sum of (a) Yankee's operating expenses for such month with respect to the plant, plus (b) an amount equal to one-twelfth of the composite percentage for such month of the net plant rate base, minus (c) any amount determined in accordance with Appendix D. Uniform System shall mean the Uniform System of Accounts prescribed by the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission for Class A and Class B Public Utilities and Licensees, as from time to time in effect. Yankee's operating expenses shall include all amounts properly chargeable to operating expense accounts, less any applicable credits thereto, in accordance with the Uniform System; it being understood that for purposes of this contract operating expenses shall include (i) depreciation or amortization accrued at a rate at least sufficient to fully amortize over the estimated remaining useful life of the plant Yankee's non-salvageable investments in plant, nuclear fuel and materials and supplies or other assets, provided, however, that if a decision is made to cease electricity production at the plant prior to July 9, 2000, then such remaining non-salvageable investments shall be amortized over a period extending to July 9, 2000; (ii) obligations incurred in connection with the leasing of fuel inventory; (iii) interest charges not associated with outstanding indebtedness; and (iv) costs incurred in connection with decommissioning the plant, including (a) the direct and indirect costs of operating, maintaining or dismantling the spent fuel storage facilities and other plant facilities after the cessation of electricity production and (b) the accruals to any reserve established by Yankee's board of directors to provide for physical decommissioning of the plant over the estimated remaining useful life of the plant, provided, however, that if a decision is made to cease electricity production at the plant prior to July 9, 2000, then the accruals to the reserve referred to in clause (b) shall be made over a period determined by Yankee's board of directors. A schedule of decommissioning charges appears in the attached Appendix B. The parties agree that the timing and amount of any billings by Yankee of the accrual referred to in the preceding clause (iv), and the Customer's continuing obligation to pay the same, are subject to the jurisdiction of the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission or its successor agency as provided by law. The amounts of the annual accrual to the decommissioning reserve shall be as from time to time approved by the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission. Consistent with paragraphs 1 and 2 of Section 6 of this Power Contract, monthly payments by the Customer to the decommissioning reserve shall be equal to the Customer's power percentage of the total decommissioning accrual for that month. Composite percentage shall be computed as of the last day of each month (the computation date ) and for any month the composite percentage shall be that computed as of the last day of the previous month. Composite percentage as of a computation date shall be the sum of (i) the annual percentage rate for return on equity then in effect as authorized by the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission multiplied by the percentage which equity investment (excluding any equity investment which relates to construction work in progress not included in net plant rate base) as of such date is of the total capital as of such date; plus (ii) the effective interest rate per annum of each principal amount of indebtedness (excluding any principal amount of indebtedness which relates to construction work in progress not included in net plant rate base) outstanding on such date for money borrowed multiplied by the percentage which such principal amount is of total capital as of such date. Equity investment as of any date shall consist of the sum of (i) all amounts theretofore paid to Yankee for all capital stock theretofore issued, plus all capital contributions, less the sum of any amounts paid by Yankee in the form of stock retirements, repurchases or redemptions or return of capital; plus (ii) any credit balance in the capital surplus account not included under (i) and any credit balance in the earned surplus account on the books of Yankee as of such date. Total capital as of any date shall be the equity investment plus the total of all indebtedness then outstanding for money borrowed. The net plant rate base shall be determined monthly and shall consist of (i) the aggregate amount properly chargeable to Yankee's utility plant accounts, including nuclear fuel accounts, in accordance with the Uniform System; less (ii) the amount of any accumulated provisions for depreciation and for amortization of nuclear fuel assemblies (exclusive of any decommissioning reserve); plus or less (iii) amounts recorded in accumulated deferred income tax accounts, as appropriate, in accordance with the applicable section of the regulation issued by the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (which as of the date hereof is codified at 18 C.F.R. 35.25); plus (iv) such allowances for materials, supplies, and prepaid items as may from time to time be determined by Yankee's board of directors; plus (v) allowances for cash working capital as permitted from time to time by the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission or its successor agency; plus (vi) the amount of any unamortized deferred expenses, as permitted from time to time by the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission or its successor agency; plus (vii) to the extent not provided for elsewhere in this paragraph, the remaining unamortized amount of the non-salvageable investment in plant, nuclear fuel and materials and supplies and other assets. Payments shall be made in cash promptly after receipt by the Customer of statements rendered by Yankee in such detail as the Customer may reasonably require. Such statements may be rendered on an estimated basis subject to corrective adjustments in subsequent billing periods. Simple interest at the prime rate then in effect at The First National Bank of Boston shall accrue on any payment delayed beyond thirty days after receipt by the Customer of a monthly statement. If any payment (other than amounts in dispute) shall be delayed beyond six months, Yankee may, by written notice, terminate this contract at the end of the next succeeding calendar month. Notwithstanding any other provision of this contract, the treatment of construction work in progress for purposes of any calculations relevant to the computation of monthly payments under this Section 6 shall conform to the applicable section of the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission's regulations respecting such items (which as of the date of this Amendment hereof is codified at 18 C.F.R. 35.26), as such regulations may be modified from time to time.

record_data.filing_title: Yankee Atomic Application to Reduce Rates Under Wholesale Power Contract

record_data.record_title: Review of Funding Adequacy & Future DOE Recovery Application
record_data.record_plain_text: Appendix D Review of Adequacy of Funding and Application of Future DOE Recoveries 1. Yankee has brought a civil action against the U.S. Department of Energy ("DOE") to recover damages suffered by Yankee during the period 2002 through 2008 caused by the failure of DOE to perform its obligations under its Standard Contract with Yankee under the Nuclear Waste Policy Act of 1982, and Yankee plans to file additional civil actions against the DOE to recover additional damages with respect to subsequent periods until DOE fully performs its obligations. Yankee shall apply any damages recovered from DOE in any such civil action and any proceeds received from DOE in settlement of any such civil action ("DOE Proceeds") as follows: a. Any DOE Proceeds that Yankee receives shall be applied as follows: i. First, the DOE Proceeds shall be applied to pay federal and state taxes due on the DOE Proceeds received; ii. Second, the remaining DOE Proceeds, if any, shall be deposited in the Decommissioning Trust Funds to the extent necessary to maintain the Financial Assurance Level, as defined in section 1(b) of this Appendix D; iii. Third, the remaining DOE Proceeds, if any, shall be deposited in an external trust fund to the extent necessary to fund Yankee's expense for post-retirement benefits other than pensions, after taxes, at the level most recently approved by the Commission. iv. Fourth, the remaining DOE Proceeds, if any, shall be applied to reduce uniformly any scheduled charges for funding of the Decommissioning Trust Funds; and v. Fifth, the remaining DOE Proceeds, if any, shall be credited to Purchasers in the manner set forth in section 2 of this Appendix D, below. b. For purposes of this Appendix D, "Financial Assurance Level" shall mean the funding required to be held in the Decommissioning Trust Funds to meet projected decommissioning costs, including costs of operating and maintaining the ISFSI and the costs of dismantling and decontaminating the ISFSI. In calculating the Financial Assurance Level, Yankee shall use: i. the cost estimate and all associated financial assumptions most recently accepted by the FERC prior to the calculation of the Financial Assurance Level, except as specified in section 1(c), below; ii. information from the end of the most recent calendar quarter for which data are available with respect to (i) actual trust fund balances, (ii) actual trust fund investment earnings; and (iii) actual decommissioning costs; and iii. the assumption that Yankee shall remain in operation for purposes of operating the ISFSI, decontaminating and dismantling the ISFSI and winding up its corporate affairs for a period of fifteen years after the date with respect to which the Financial Assurance Level is calculated, notwithstanding the date projected for the end of Yankee's corporate life in the cost estimate, unless section 1(d), below, applies; c. If Yankee has submitted a revised decommissioning cost estimate to the FERC that is pending before the FERC at the time Yankee is calculating the Financial Assurance Level, Yankee shall initially use the pending cost estimate and associated financial assumptions to calculate the Financial Assurance Level, provided that the calculation shall be trued-up to reflect any revisions to the cost estimate and financial assumptions required by the resolution of proceedings on the pending estimate. d. Once DOE has begun to transfer spent nuclear fuel from Yankee's ISFSI to a repository operated by DOE, Yankee shall use a projection of the period required for the completion of the transfer of spent nuclear fuel and greater than Class C waste, the decontamination and dismantlement of the ISFSI, and the wind up of its corporate affairs in lieu of the fifteen-year period specified in section 1(b)(iii), above. If the NRC issues a regulation, order or other directive requiring a demonstration of financial assurance for spent fuel storage operations greater than that provided by the use of the fifteen-year period specified in section 1(b)(iii), above, Yankee shall use a period sufficient to satisfy the NRC requirement in the calculation of the Financial Assurance Level. Yankee shall implement either such change through an application to FERC under section 205 of the Federal Power Act, as provided in section 5, below. 2. Within sixty days of its receipt of DOE Proceeds, Yankee shall provide its calculation of the Financial Assurance Level in accordance with section 1(b, calculated as of the end of the most recent calendar quarter for which data are available, and the application of the DOE Proceeds in accordance with section 1(a) to the entities that executed the Stipulation and Settlement Agreement submitted to FERC in the application that proposed to add this Appendix D to the Additional Power Contract (the "Signatories"). a. Yankee shall include work papers supporting its calculations. Yankee shall also include notice of a technical conference (which may be conducted in person, by telephone or by internet conference) at which Yankee shall describe its calculation and to respond to questions regarding its calculation from any Signatory. The Signatories shall have fifteen business days from receipt of Yankee's calculation to provide to Yankee (with copies to all Signatories) any written objections to Yankee's calculation and Yankee shall have ten business days from receipt to provide to all Signatories written responses to any objections raised. Any Signatory may request in writing that Yankee provide information relevant to its calculation and Yankee shall endeavor in good faith to respond to such requests within ten days of receipt, provided that Yankee shall not be required to provide information protected by any privilege and the Signatories shall hold in confidence any information that Yankee identifies as proprietary or commercially sensitive. Any information that Yankee provides in response to such requests may be used in challenges to Yankee's informational filing, provided that any information that Yankee labels as proprietary or commercially sensitive shall be subject to FERC's procedures for the protection of such information. Yankee and any objecting Signatory shall negotiate in good faith to seek to resolve any objection for a period of forty-five days after an objection is provided, which period may be extended by mutual agreement among Yankee and all Signatories that presented objections that have not been resolved. b. If Yankee's calculation, adjusted if applicable to reflect the resolution of any objections through negotiations, results in a credit to Purchasers or a reduction in decommissioning charges or if Yankee proposes no change in decommissioning charges: i. Yankee shall submit an informational filing to the FERC within thirty days of: (i) the last day for submission of objections if no Signatory objects to Yankee's calculation; (ii) the date the last objection to Yankee's calculation is resolved through negotiations; or (iii) the end of the period provided in section 2(a) for negotiations to attempt to resolve objections to Yankee's calculation, whichever date occurs last. In the informational filing, Yankee shall describe the results of the calculation of the Financial Assurance Level, reflecting, if applicable, the resolution of any objections raised by a Signatory, and any resulting reduction in decommissioning charges and any resulting credit to the Purchasers. Yankee shall implement the reduced decommissioning charges and provide any credit to the Purchasers beginning with the charge due for the first month beginning at least thirty days after the submission of the informational filing. ii. If any Signatory objects to Yankee's calculation and the objection is not resolved in accordance with section 2(a), above, that Signatory may protest or file comments on Yankee's informational filing, setting forth its objection or objections to Yankee's calculation, and any Signatory may take any position on any such objection. In any proceeding established by FERC to review Yankee's informational filing: (i) the proceeding shall be limited to the issue of the consistency of Yankee's calculation with sections 1(a) and 1(b), unless FERC consolidates the proceeding with a proceeding established under section 205 or section 206 of the Federal Power Act; (ii) Yankee shall bear the burden of proving that its calculation is consistent with sections 1(a) and 1(b); and (iii) any adjustment to Yankee's decommissioning charges and/or credits based on a determination that Yankee's calculation was inconsistent with sections 1(a) and 1(b) shall take effect beginning with the charge due for the first month beginning at least thirty days after the FERC's order is issued, subject to rehearing and potential judicial review. iii. If a calculation is based on a pending decommissioning estimate, as specified in section 1(c), and the resolution of proceedings on that estimate requires Yankee to revise a calculation provided under this section 2, Yankee shall provide the revised calculation to the Signatories and the procedures set forth in section 2(a) and, if the revised calculation results in a further credit or reduction in decommissioning charges, the procedures set forth in section 2(b), shall apply to the revised calculation. c. If Yankee's calculation identifies a deficiency in the Decommissioning Trust Fund and Yankee proposes to resume or increase decommissioning charges, Yankee may at any time submit an application to implement such new or revised charges under section 205 of the Federal Power Act, as provided in section 4, below. If the procedures set forth in section 2(a) are under way at the time Yankee submits such an application, Yankee shall nevertheless complete those procedures. 3. If Yankee does not receive DOE proceeds within five years of the effective dates of the this Appendix D or, thereafter, within five years of the most recent informational filing described in section 2(b) or rate filing described in section 2(c), Yankee shall nevertheless provide its calculation of the Financial Assurance Level in accordance with section 1(b), calculated as of the end of the most recent calendar quarter for which data are available, to the Signatories. The procedures set forth in section 2(a) shall apply to the calculation. Yankee shall submit an informational filing to the FERC within thirty days of: (i) the last day for submission of objections if no Signatory objects to Yankee's calculation; (ii) the date the last objection to Yankee's calculation is resolved through negotiations; or (iii) the end of the period provided in the preceding sentence for negotiations to attempt to resolve objections to Yankee's calculation, whichever date occurs last. Yankee's informational filing shall describe the results of the calculation of the Financial Assurance Level. If Yankee proposes to initiate or modify any charges to the Purchasers in light of its calculation of the Financial Assurance Level, it may combine such informational filing with an application under section 205 of the Federal Power Act. 4. Nothing in this Appendix D shall restrict (i) the right of Yankee at any time to submit an application to the FERC under section 205 of the Federal Power Act to modify any of its rates or charges, including, without limitation, decommissioning charges and charges to recover expenses for postretirement benefits other than pensions, or the right of any other Signatory to take any position regarding such application; or (ii) the right of any Signatory at any time to submit a petition or complaint to the FERC under section 206 of the Federal Power Act to modify any of Yankee's rates or charges or the right of any other Signatory to take any position regarding such petition or complaint. Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, if Yankee desires to modify the cost estimate or any of the other assumptions used to calculate the Financial Assurance Level under section 1(b), above, Yankee shall submit an application to the FERC proposing the change or changes it believes appropriate and Yankee shall bear the burden of proving that the change it proposes yields rates that are just, reasonable, and not unduly discriminatory or preferential. 5. Together with its second calculation of the Financial Assurance Level that Yankee provides to the Signatories pursuant to section 2 subsequent to September 1, 2019 or, if Yankee has not provided two such calculations by September 1, 2033, by no later than October 1, 2033, Yankee shall submit to the Signatories a recommendation either: (a) to continue the procedures set forth in this Appendix D; (b) to modify the procedures set forth in this Appendix D; or (c) to delete the procedures set forth in this Appendix D in whole or in part. Yankee shall consult with the Signatories regarding its recommendation during the period for review and negotiation of Yankee's Financial Assurance Level calculation under section 2(a), or, if the recommendation is not presented in connection with such a calculation, for a period of sixty days, which may be shortened or extended by mutual agreement among Yankee and the Signatories. If Yankee and the Signatories agree to continue the procedures set forth in this Appendix D, Yankee shall include a statement to that effect in the next informational filing it submits pursuant to section 2(b). If Yankee and the Signatories agree to modify or delete the procedures set forth in this Appendix D, Yankee shall include the necessary revisions to the Power Contract in an application to FERC under section 205 of the Federal Power Act. If Yankee and the Signatories cannot agree, Yankee shall submit its proposal in an application to FERC under section 205 and Yankee shall bear the burden of proving that its proposal is just, reasonable, and not unduly discriminatory or preferential. All Signatories shall have the right to take any position regarding Yankee's application. Nothing in this section 5 shall restrict any right of Yankee or any Signatory under section 4, including the right to propose modifications to this Appendix D prior to the date of Yankee's application under this section.
